intro: Tagetes coronopifolia, commonly known as Mexican marigold or golden marigold, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers and pinnately divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a strong, spicy scent. Tagetes coronopifolia is also used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
